item.title: Moving to Moose Hackathon 2012
item.description: This week, my excellent Perl Mongers group Oslo.pm, led by the excellent Salve, has arranged an event we called the Moving to Moose Hackathon 2012. The purpose of this event was to promote the adoption of a MOP (Meta Object Protocol) in Perl development. To this effect, we had two groups, the Perl RDF community, looking to adopt moose in their modules, and Stevan Little and his merry gang of p5-mop developers, looking to create a proposal for a MOP in the Perl core itself, to replace the venerable blessed hash object model.

item.title: Burning the candle at both ends.
item.description: In addition to recent fatherhood and doing my own startup, I am now the leader of the Oslo Perl Mongers. Look forward to tech talks from Oslo.pm in the months to come. :)
